title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Package contains customized functions common operations used human genome analysis.

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: development version CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome package available https://github.com/vinodsinghjnu/CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome can installed
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("vinodsinghjnu/CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome",build_vignettes = TRUE )

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: add assembly information genomic range.

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: addGrInformation(gr.f=gr, assmblyName='hg19')

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: gr.f: genomic range. assmblyName: human genome assembly name .e., hg19 hg38 t2t. Default hg19

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: function add genomic length assembly name given genomic ranges (Human genome ). remove non-standard chromosomes genomic ranges report bad genomic ranges selected genome assembly.

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: returns input genomic range along assembly information.

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
code: gr <- GRanges(seqnames = "chr1", strand = c("+", "-", "+"),  ranges = IRanges(start = c(1,110,105), end = c(100, 120, 150 )))  outGr=addGrInformation(gr.f=gr, assmblyName='hg19') outGr ## GRanges object with 3 ranges and 0 metadata columns: ##       seqnames    ranges strand ##          <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle> ##   [1]     chr1     1-100      + ##   [2]     chr1   110-120      - ##   [3]     chr1   105-150      + ##   ------- ##   seqinfo: 24 sequences from 2 genomes (hg19, NA)

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Percent overlap GenomicRange

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: pctOverlap_Of_FirstGrToSecondGr(FirstContext=gr1, SecondContext=gr2)

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: FirstContext: GenomicRange object. (query: overlapped) SecondContext: GenomicRange object. (overlapped )

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Percent overlap genomic range .

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Percent overlap first genomic range second genomic range

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
code: gr1 <- GRanges(seqnames = "chr1", strand = c("+", "-", "+"),  ranges = IRanges(start = c(1,110,105), end = c(100, 120, 150 )))  gr2 <- GRanges(seqnames = "chr1", strand = c("+", "-", "+", "+"),  ranges = IRanges(start = c(1,12,60, 105), end = c(25, 50, 70, 115 )))  pctOverlap_Of_FirstGrToSecondGr(FirstContext=gr1, SecondContext=gr2) ## [1] 45.85987

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Create empty chromosome GenomicRange object given human genome assembly

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: emptyChrGranges(assmblyName='hg19'))

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: assmblyName: hg19 hg38 t2t

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Create empty chromosome GenomicRange object given human genome assembly

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Create empty chromosome GenomicRange object given human genome assembly Note: Output object labelled assembly information.

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
code: hg_19_Chr.gr=emptyChrGranges('hg19') head(hg_19_Chr.gr) ## GRanges object with 6 ranges and 1 metadata column: ##       seqnames      ranges strand |                    Seqs ##          <Rle>   <IRanges>  <Rle> |          <DNAStringSet> ##   [1]     chr1 1-249250621      * | NNNNNNNNNN...NNNNNNNNNN ##   [2]     chr2 1-243199373      * | NNNNNNNNNN...NNNNNNNNNN ##   [3]     chr3 1-198022430      * | NNNNNNNNNN...NNNNNNNNNN ##   [4]     chr4 1-191154276      * | NNNNNNNNNN...NNNNNNNNNN ##   [5]     chr5 1-180915260      * | NNNNNNNNNN...NNNNNNNNNN ##   [6]     chr6 1-171115067      * | NNNNNNNNNN...NNNNNNNNNN ##   ------- ##   seqinfo: 24 sequences from hg19 genome

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Create GenomicRanges object given bin size human genome.

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: getGbins(assmblyName='hg19', binSize=1000 )

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: assmblyName: hg19 hg38 0r t2t binSize: size genomic block chrName: name chromosome, given chromosomes considered (UCSC format)

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Create GenomicRanges object given bin size human genome.

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: GenomicRanges object given bin size Note: Output object labelled assembly information.

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
code: hg_19_Bins.gr=getGbins(assmblyName='hg19', binSize=1000 ) head(hg_19_Bins.gr) ## GRanges object with 6 ranges and 1 metadata column: ##       seqnames    ranges strand | CpG_counts ##          <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle> |  <numeric> ##   [1]     chr1    1-1000      * |          0 ##   [2]     chr1 1001-2000      * |          0 ##   [3]     chr1 2001-3000      * |          0 ##   [4]     chr1 3001-4000      * |          0 ##   [5]     chr1 4001-5000      * |          0 ##   [6]     chr1 5001-6000      * |          0 ##   ------- ##   seqinfo: 24 sequences from hg19 genome

text: Generate possible DNA sequences Ambiguous nucleotide sequence

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: vector possible DNA sequences given Ambiguous nucleotide sequence

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
code: DNA_seqs=DNASeqsForPattern(pat='NYYN') DNA_seqs ##  [1] "ACCA" "CTTC" "GCCG" "TTTT" "ATCA" "CCTC" "GTCG" "TCTT" "ACTA" "CTCC" ## [11] "GCTG" "TTCT" "ATTA" "CCCC" "GTTG" "TCCT" "ACCC" "CTTG" "GCCT" "TTTA" ## [21] "ATCC" "CCTG" "GTCT" "TCTA" "ACTC" "CTCG" "GCTT" "TTCA" "ATTC" "CCCG" ## [31] "GTTT" "TCCA" "ACCG" "CTTT" "GCCA" "TTTC" "ATCG" "CCTT" "GTCA" "TCTC" ## [41] "ACTG" "CTCT" "GCTA" "TTCC" "ATTG" "CCCT" "GTTA" "TCCC" "ACCT" "CTTA" ## [51] "GCCC" "TTTG" "ATCT" "CCTA" "GTCC" "TCTG" "ACTT" "CTCA" "GCTC" "TTCG" ## [61] "ATTT" "CCCA" "GTTC" "TCCG"

text: Create directory given name. (delete directory already existing )

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
code: createDir_delIfExists(dir='testDir') ## Old Directory has been deletedNew Directory has been created dir.exists('testDir') ## [1] TRUE

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: oligo-nucleotide counts within genomic context.

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: context_oligonucsCounts(contextGr=hg_38_gr, oligoType='trinucs', ignore.strand=FALSE, assmblyName='hg38')

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: contextGr: GenomicRange object genomic context within oligo-nucleotides counted. oligoType: dinucs trinucs tetranucs ignore.strand: genomic context strand information considered. Default: FALSE assmblyName: human genome assembly name (hg19 hg38). Default: hg19

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: oligo-nucleotide counts within genomic context.

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: vector oligo-nucleotide counts

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
code: data(hg_38_gr)  oligonucs.Counts=context_oligonucsCounts(contextGr=hg_38_gr, oligoType='trinucs', ignore.strand=FALSE, assmblyName='hg38')  oligonucs.Counts ##     AAA     AAC     AAG     AAT     ACA     ACC     ACG     ACT     AGA     AGC  ## 1325123  507680  697059  857418  698085  401071   87610  563602  766871  484544  ##     AGG     AGT     ATA     ATC     ATG     ATT     CAA     CAC     CAG     CAT  ##  615364  563602  706620  461672  634677  857418  649772  517039  700902  634677  ##     CCA     CCC     CCG     CCT     CGA     CGC     CGG     CGT     CTA     CTC  ##  630048  447455   94106  615364   76306   81429   94106   87610  451366  581037  ##     CTG     CTT     GAA     GAC     GAG     GAT     GCA     GCC     GCG     GCT  ##  700902  697059  685228  326166  581037  461672  496828  405020   81429  484544  ##     GGA     GGC     GGG     GGT     GTA     GTC     GTG     GTT     TAA     TAC  ##  533465  405020  447455  401071  399481  326166  517039  507680  727231  399481  ##     TAG     TAT     TCA     TCC     TCG     TCT     TGA     TGC     TGG     TGT  ##  451366  706620  677442  533465   76306  766871  677442  496828  630048  698085  ##     TTA     TTC     TTG     TTT  ##  727231  685228  649772 1325123

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Get genomic range ProteinCodingGenes promoters (upst -200)

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: getPromGRange(upst = 500, assmblyName)

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: upst: Upstream promoter. Promoter region “upst” -200 TSS. DEFAULT value 500 assmblyName: human genome assembly name (hg19 hg38). Default: hg19

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: genomic ranges protein coding genes promoter give assembly.

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
code: outGr=getPromGRange(upst=500, assmblyName='hg19') ## 'select()' returned many:many mapping between keys and columns outGr$proteinCoding.proms ## GRanges object with 18918 ranges and 2 metadata columns: ##          seqnames            ranges strand |     gene_id ##             <Rle>         <IRanges>  <Rle> | <character> ##    79501     chr1       68591-69290      + |       79501 ##   729759     chr1     367159-367858      + |      729759 ##   148398     chr1     860030-860729      + |      148398 ##   339451     chr1     895467-896166      + |      339451 ##    84069     chr1     901377-902076      + |       84069 ##      ...      ...               ...    ... .         ... ##     1617     chrY 25345055-25345754      - |        1617 ##    57135     chrY 26959440-26960139      - |       57135 ##     9085     chrY 26193962-26194661      - |        9085 ##    57054     chrY 26959440-26960139      - |       57054 ##     9083     chrY 27198052-27198751      - |        9083 ##                                  GenesMap ##                              <data.frame> ##    79501   79501:OR4F5:protein-coding:... ##   729759 729759:OR4F29:protein-coding:... ##   148398 148398:SAMD11:protein-coding:... ##   339451 339451:KLHL17:protein-coding:... ##    84069 84069:PLEKHN1:protein-coding:... ##      ...                              ... ##     1617     1617:DAZ1:protein-coding:... ##    57135    57135:DAZ4:protein-coding:... ##     9085     9085:CDY1:protein-coding:... ##    57054    57054:DAZ3:protein-coding:... ##     9083     9083:BPY2:protein-coding:... ##   ------- ##   seqinfo: 24 sequences from hg19 genome outGr$proteinCoding.genes ## GRanges object with 18918 ranges and 2 metadata columns: ##          seqnames            ranges strand |     gene_id ##             <Rle>         <IRanges>  <Rle> | <character> ##    79501     chr1       69091-70008      + |       79501 ##   729759     chr1     367659-368597      + |      729759 ##   148398     chr1     860530-879961      + |      148398 ##   339451     chr1     895967-901099      + |      339451 ##    84069     chr1     901877-910484      + |       84069 ##      ...      ...               ...    ... .         ... ##     1617     chrY 25275502-25345254      - |        1617 ##    57135     chrY 25275502-26959639      - |       57135 ##     9085     chrY 26191377-26194161      - |        9085 ##    57054     chrY 26909216-26959639      - |       57054 ##     9083     chrY 27177050-27198251      - |        9083 ##                                  GenesMap ##                              <data.frame> ##    79501   79501:OR4F5:protein-coding:... ##   729759 729759:OR4F29:protein-coding:... ##   148398 148398:SAMD11:protein-coding:... ##   339451 339451:KLHL17:protein-coding:... ##    84069 84069:PLEKHN1:protein-coding:... ##      ...                              ... ##     1617     1617:DAZ1:protein-coding:... ##    57135    57135:DAZ4:protein-coding:... ##     9085     9085:CDY1:protein-coding:... ##    57054    57054:DAZ3:protein-coding:... ##     9083     9083:BPY2:protein-coding:... ##   ------- ##   seqinfo: 24 sequences from hg19 genome

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Create GenomicRange genomic blocks user specified CpG counts. (human genome)

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Gbin_ByCGcnts(CGs_perBin=100, assmblyName='hg19' )

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: assmblyName: hg19 hg38 t2t CGs_perBin: CpG counts genomic block/bin. (even number) oligo-nucleotides counted. addSeq: sequence bin required (Default: FALSE)

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Creates GenomicRange genomic blocks user specified CpG counts. (human genome)

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: GenomicRanges object bins user specified CpG counts

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Memory usage large variable workspace

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: largeVariables(n)

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: n: Number top memory consuming variables required

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Memory variable decreasing order

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: DataFrame top memory variables

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
code: largeVariables(n=5) ##                    Class      KB       GB ## hg_19_Chr.gr     GRanges 3023145 3.023145 ## hg_19_Bins.gr    GRanges   48383 0.048383 ## outGr               list   18654 0.018654 ## hg_19_CpGBins.gr GRanges    4422 0.004422 ## hg_38_gr         GRanges     176 0.000176

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: make tracks list GenomicRange lists.

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: makeTracks_of_grangesList(grlist, location, assmblyName)

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: grlist: GenomicRange object genomic context within oligo-nucleotides counted. location: location chromosome List. ie., list(chr=‘chr7’,=26700000, =26750000) assmblyName: human genome assembly name (hg19 hg38). Default: hg19

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: Make tracks genomic ranges objects list

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
text: list tracks input list genomic ranges objects.

title: CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome
code: # example 1 data(cpgIslands)  mygrlist=list(gr1=cpgIslands,gr2=cpgIslands) loc=list(chr='chr7',from=26700000, to=26750000) tracks=makeTracks_of_grangesList(grlist=mygrlist, location=loc, assmblyName='hg19') plotTracks(tracks, from = loc$from, to = loc$to) # example 2, only genomic ranges no annotation gr1 <- GRanges(seqnames = "chr1", strand = c("+", "-", "+"),  ranges = IRanges(start = c(1,110,105), end = c(100, 120, 150 )))  gr2 <- GRanges(seqnames = "chr1", strand = c("+", "-", "+", "+"),  ranges = IRanges(start = c(1,12,60, 105), end = c(25, 50, 70, 115 )))  plotTracks(makeTracks_of_grangesList(list(gr1=gr1,gr2=gr2), if_plain=TRUE), shape="box")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Vinod Singh. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Singh V (2024). CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome: Frequently used customised BioInfomatics Fuctions analyse HumanGenome. https://github.com/vinodsinghjnu/CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome, https://vinodsinghjnu.github.io/CustomBioInfoFuctionsHumanGenome/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome: Frequently used customised BioInfomatics Fuctions to analyse HumanGenome},   author = {Vinod Singh},   year = {2024},   note = {https://github.com/vinodsinghjnu/CustomBioInfoFunctionsHumanGenome, https://vinodsinghjnu.github.io/CustomBioInfoFuctionsHumanGenome/}, }

text: grlist: GenomicRange object genomic context within oligo-nucleotides counted. location: location chromosome List. ie., list(chr=‘chr7’,=26700000, =26750000) assmblyName: human genome assembly name (hg19 hg38). Default: hg19

title: Frequently used customised BioInfomatics Fuctions to analyse HumanGenome
text: list tracks input list genomic ranges objects.

title: Frequently used customised BioInfomatics Fuctions to analyse HumanGenome
code: # example 1 data(cpgIslands)  mygrlist=list(gr1=cpgIslands,gr2=cpgIslands) loc=list(chr='chr7',from=26700000, to=26750000) tracks=makeTracks_of_grangesList(grlist=mygrlist, location=loc, assmblyName='hg19') plotTracks(tracks, from = loc$from, to = loc$to) # example 2, only genomic ranges no annotation gr1 <- GRanges(seqnames = "chr1", strand = c("+", "-", "+"),  ranges = IRanges(start = c(1,110,105), end = c(100, 120, 150 )))  gr2 <- GRanges(seqnames = "chr1", strand = c("+", "-", "+", "+"),  ranges = IRanges(start = c(1,12,60, 105), end = c(25, 50, 70, 115 )))  plotTracks(makeTracks_of_grangesList(list(gr1=gr1,gr2=gr2), if_plain=TRUE), shape="box")

title: make tracks list from GenomicRange lists. — makeTracks_of_grangesList
text: grlist list genomic range objects. location list genomic location fields ´chr´, ´´ ´´. Optional: Must given choose ´if_plain=FALSE´ assmblyName human genome assembly name (hg19 hg38 t2t). Default: hg19 if_plain : ´TRUE´ return tracks given genomic range. Default: FALSE: Tracks given chromosomes also returned.

title: make tracks list from GenomicRange lists. — makeTracks_of_grangesList
text: list tracks input list genomic ranges objects.

title: make tracks list from GenomicRange lists. — makeTracks_of_grangesList
code: data(cpgIslands) mygrlist=list(gr1=cpgIslands,gr2=cpgIslands) loc=list(chr='chr7',from=26700000, to=26750000) tracks=makeTracks_of_grangesList(grlist=mygrlist, location=loc, assmblyName='hg19') plotTracks(tracks, from = loc$from, to = loc$to)   # Example 2, only genomic ranges no annotation  gr1 <- GRanges(seqnames = "chr1", strand = c("+", "-", "+"),  ranges = IRanges(start = c(1,110,105), end = c(100, 120, 150 ))) gr2 <- GRanges(seqnames = "chr1", strand = c("+", "-", "+", "+"),  ranges = IRanges(start = c(1,12,60, 105), end = c(25, 50, 70, 115 ))) plotTracks(makeTracks_of_grangesList(list(gr1=gr1,gr2=gr2), if_plain=TRUE), shape="box")

what: Percent overlap of a GenomicRange with other — pctOverlap_Of_FirstGrToSecondGr
title: Percent overlap of a GenomicRange with other — pctOverlap_Of_FirstGrToSecondGr
text: Percent overlap genomic range

title: Percent overlap of a GenomicRange with other — pctOverlap_Of_FirstGrToSecondGr
code: pctOverlap_Of_FirstGrToSecondGr(FirstContext, SecondContext)

title: Percent overlap of a GenomicRange with other — pctOverlap_Of_FirstGrToSecondGr
text: FirstContext GenomicRange object. (query: overlapped) SecondContext GenomicRange object. (overlapped )

title: Percent overlap of a GenomicRange with other — pctOverlap_Of_FirstGrToSecondGr
text: Percent overlap first genomic range second genomic range

title: Percent overlap of a GenomicRange with other — pctOverlap_Of_FirstGrToSecondGr
code: gr1 <- GRanges(seqnames = "chr1", strand = c("+", "-", "+"),  ranges = IRanges(start = c(1,110,105), end = c(100, 120, 150 ))) gr2 <- GRanges(seqnames = "chr1", strand = c("+", "-", "+", "+"),  ranges = IRanges(start = c(1,12,60, 105), end = c(25, 50, 70, 115 ))) pctOverlap_Of_FirstGrToSecondGr(FirstContext=gr1, SecondContext=gr2) #> [1] 45.85987
